sense.name: court enclosure
sense.commentary: an enclosure in a court of law where the defendant sits during the trial
sense.examples: John yelled at the plaintiff from the dock at the beginning of the trial.

sense.name: sour grass
sense.commentary: sorrel - any of certain coarse weedy plants with long taproots, sometimes used as table greens or in fold medicine
sense.examples: The recipe calls for six oz. dock root. Kate makes a dye from dock.

sense.name: pier
sense.commentary: wharf, wharfage, dockage, docking facility - landing in a harbor next to a pier where ships are loaded and unloaded or repaired, may have gates to let water in and out
sense.examples: The ship arrived at the dock more than a day late.

sense.name: loading dock
sense.commentary: a platform where trucks or trains can be loaded or unloaded
sense.examples: The dock is in use right now, Earl, you'll have to wait. The line for the dock was almost twenty trucks long.

sense.name: solid part of a tail
sense.commentary: the solid bony part of the tail of an animal as distinguished from the long hair
sense.examples: The hair grows out of the dock of the tail. This horse has a longer dock than most.

sense.name: bobtail
sense.commentary: bob - a short or shortened tail of certain animals
sense.examples: The dock on the pit bull wagged furiously when Fido came to visit.
